document.title: Massachusetts English Language Arts and Literacy Framework

89F100988E9D423F86E2D2C048A8890F.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, activities in the kindergarten curriculum, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

9DB33DBB0E3B41078643C19D671ABEF5.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

9E8A9FE7FAA64996B76A6B33247DAE9C.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

9BE29233FA384B698686C62A0DA8185B.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

DDD1694C504C4658B1F7204FBC98DDCC.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

1E65821F50874A6D8A58CE1FE6102E08.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

B49A0F51399B4042B33D680B125CC901.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

B21C772AE1104C7493F2DCA6055EE66F.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

B44C55D7FDCC414A8A7E71BEB64B305B.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

09E7A7B68B0349C6B48543121C5BF807.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

FCAC1E4431A44497942D1FE641F63DCF.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

A94C5D359CCF4C83B22AFFB39A3EC2DA.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

604F29952D084AA4AA5FBE403F5E1403.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/.

A626A557E7824288872BDEBFA323A404.description: Form questions that seek additional information, rather than a simple yes/no answer.

B018C894EE1A45D0AE08944932C7E14E.description: Demonstrate the ability to produce and expand complete sentences using frequently occurring nouns, pronouns, adjectives, verbs, question words, and prepositions; name and use in context numbers 0â€“100.

D6800017E435400F97F7088E6117B5EE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking; retain and further develop language skills learned previously.

B8F4CC26DD214D49BD052199B4A1D0B0.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

0BC025D9D310481C87EB5A46C59185E7.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

8326B2D146AD4335A0D41A51287351A7.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

35B403F25CC04AB887C10CA62F722D80.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

7599B1A2E3354E9A96C7B8513BDD5785.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

14C17AD86649494BA606CC3C91946783.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

A880DA4604864EC4B73E31BF7F40983A.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

3791C05B80A54271B66B46C1DD0A8F7C.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

493E25D2BD1546AE868120566300BD3B.description: Write or dictate writing routinely for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

0F4785CE291F4432BBE7A4F62C6D1607.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

D7261FBEAFC64929923DABE2C264AB5F.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

A7B853A417C24F6899975B2E8C726064.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

676A68C906EC4EAB8DDF1E2656C1F906.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including collaboration with peers.

21ED3FCA86E34A0CBB4BD97A40DA159F.description: Demonstrate the ability to use vocabulary appropriate for kindergarten.

BEAF202B1DC54B4FA21AAE83A1895FCF.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

FC28B345D28248A7A65B45B8683829CF.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts that name and supply some information about a topic.

D1A460BB31D6417AA64ADA6634D0F456.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces that tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

6CAC41550F1D4C228A22D1105425007B.description: Read early-emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

258E0001D40D4E0F87593D4DCEDD6364.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

051D03D5701944D3B0AE81E7871C5415.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

4B83CDD4456B4CB6A2E635F218882E51.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

BD1247A4B91242DB97B02C58E843BE7C.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

B71A8E09FFD543A391EF10F6C24FC58B.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

77AE7A20F5BB4E74B86DE081D5B604F3.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

0CEF8194167348948D4B35EF081033C8.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

1A0695B135714733B3595FD07ED05967.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

BBE53E4CE80C4B8FB1FADBF81A9C3CFE.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

12104ED7748C4978956459CF7259EF9A.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

1947F13D4465425C8C74F72D697B69C7.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

1A91C9B3713041ECA7BA756090176FCF.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

A6020EB9FBD043F8882B5C58854C7212.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

F587418B35164A90842E230240DEA5CD.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

F3069E956E0A459E9FA3C346547DF702.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

465BA71CEE9D4C2D89C43964A89B4D8D.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B973FD6E52D646FB887670A9DF44ECF9.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, procedures).

618A134DECA2413998DB17415BB04F3E.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

64CD31E1BA644DEDAF8C83D2158D8D99.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts). For example, students study the life cycles of plants and animals. Read-alouds from books such as One Bean by Anne Rockwell, From Seed to Plant by Gail Gibbons, and A Tree is a Plant by Clyde Robert Bulla introduce students to core science concepts and vocabulary through illustrations and words. Students draw, dictate, and write observations in science journals. (RI.K.2, RI.K.4, RI.K.7, SL.K.5, L.K.6)

424BB782A4A049F5BD1F489D727BD77F.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in the text.

849E32A4903343F69FD827266722B562.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

C6076961AEBD4FA79660F98B36EFD2F4.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

632D9F711CE6440DB8F2E4DE0080B980.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

F1603DAB10254C16A86C1BBC432D50CC.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

728F16B464C1410590BBD1A219E5412F.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

F55C6109237F4C1AA92D45A27C5B1F57.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

801C2CD31082429DA4A232261534E216.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3BE2E349C4DD49D29A710E2897AC987C.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

6D5B15A3791345B6AA2658F6E5CD47A4.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

399047A6A89D4D0D87B650B95250A42A.description: With prompting and support, explain that reading the cover or title page is how to find out who created a book; name the author and illustrator of a book and define the role of each in telling the story.

BAFAAAC0C5E44B2783A3D5B5AF12C45E.description: Recognize common types of texts and characteristics of their structure (e.g., story elements in books; rhyme, rhythm, and repetition in poems).

573179D69DC5416AB5E573ADF6E656E1.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

AFCF58CA0AAB42D2B20F49E3BEE8978E.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

FA33C7D47E114D73A17FD8FC91D13C2C.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

1B4AF975E7384B428D785F5C68DFAC94.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
